III. INVESTIGATION
Rule Code Staff sufficiency
Title
Rule Code & COF Rule 400.10123
Section (1) A facility shall have a staffing pattern of administrative,
Description supervisory, direct care, and other staff sufficient to perform the
prescribed functions required by these administrative rules and to
provide for the needs, protection, and supervision of the residents.
Violation Potential Rule or Statute Violation
Type
Allegation Youth has been making sexually inappropriate comments and
sexual assaults towards another youth. Staff is aware and has
advised the victim youth to stay close to them.
Investigation Interviews:
Complaint Source was interviewed via phone on February 6,
2024. Complaint Source reported Youth A told Staff 1 about these
concerns and she told him to file a grievance and to stay close to
staff. Supervisor then met with Youth A about the grievance and told
Youth A to just stay away from Youth B.
Youth A was interviewed face to face at the facility on February
8, 2024, in collaboration with MDHHS Worker 1. MDHHS Worker
2 completed translation services for Youth A. Youth A reported
Youth B has been making sexual comments toward him and other
youth on the pod. He reported Youth B has stated the following “suck
my balls”, “suck my dick”, “I’m going to rape you when you are
sleeping,” and “there’s white stuff on your face, it’s my semen.” Youth
A reported Youth B would make these comments under his breath
and in situations where staff could not hear him. He reported Youth B
threatened to harm him if he told anyone about the situation. Youth A
reported he does remember one time staff overheard Youth A make
a sexual comment and they gave him a consequence. When asked if
Youth B ever touched him inappropriately, he reported Youth B had
touched him on two different occasions. Youth A reported about four
weeks ago on the unit, when they were sitting at the table, Youth A
had touched Youth B’s thigh under the table. He denied that anyone
saw this happen or that he told anyone about it. Youth A does not
remember what staff was working that day. Youth A reported the
second time was about three weeks ago, Youth B slapped his butt
while walking from the unit to the cafeteria. He reported Youth B did
2

this when in an area where they knew there was no camera. He
reported he was not sure if the staff saw this as they were heading to
lunch from the pod. Youth A reported does not remember who was
working but remembers a female staff was leading them to the
cafeteria and turned around to ask what was going on back there
after Youth B had touched his butt. Youth A denied he told staff
about this situation. Youth A reported the only staff member she told
at the facility was Staff 1 and he only told her about the sexual
comments Youth B was making towards him. He reported Staff 1
assisted him with filing a grievance about the situation and was told
to stay near staff members so Youth A would not make any more
comments in staff earshot and the situation would be investigated.
He reported Supervisor followed up with him about the grievance and
he reported he still never told anyone about the touching. Youth A
reported since the grievance was filed Youth B has not touched him
or made any comments. He reported Youth B has since been moved
from his pod and he feels safer. Youth A reported staff does a good
job at supervising, Youth B was just sneaky.
Youth B was interviewed face to face at the facility on February
8, 2024, in collaboration with MDHHS Worker 1. Youth B reported
he knew why he was being interviewed because he just talked to his
Foster Care Worker, and she tried to make him sign a safety plan.
When asked to explain more, Youth B reported youth on the unit are
making false allegations against him. He reported Youth C was
making allegations against him stating Youth B touched his thigh and
butt. He reported he has never touched any youth at the facility.
When asked about the comments he had made, Youth B reported
that he never said anything sexually to anyone. He reported that he
did call a youth a “nigger” but said it was not with the “hard r” and he
was just playing around. He reported that he did not have any
problems with Youth A at all. He reported youth on the pad are
making accusations against him for no reason. When asked about
staff supervision, he reported staff are always watching and
redirecting youth when youth are not even doing anything wrong.
Youth C was interviewed face to face at the facility on February
8, 2024, in collaboration with MDHHS Worker 1. Youth C reported
Youth B has been making inappropriate sexual comments towards
him. He was asked to provide examples, but he refused as he stated
he did not feel comfortable stating it. Youth C was asked if Youth B
had done anything else to make him feel uncomfortable and he
reported Youth B would talk about his personal life and make
comments about sexual things, that made him feel uneasy. He
reported Youth B touched his arms at times which he did not like.
Youth C denied Youth B ever sexually touching him. He reported he
never told staff about the comments until he completed the grievance
form on February 4, 2024. Youth C reported he did not think it was a
3

big deal and just tried to avoid Youth B. He reported Staff 1 assisted
with the grievance and told him to stay away from Youth B. Youth C
reported Supervisor did come speak to him about the grievance and
now Youth B is not on the pod. He reported he never saw or heard
about Youth B touching anyone inappropriately. Youth C reported
staff are constantly supervising the unit and Youth B makes
comments when staff are not looking or cannot hear it.
Staff 1 was interviewed face to face at the facility on February 8,
2024, in collaboration with MDHHS Worker 1. Staff 1 reported she
has been working at the facility for about seven months. She
reported she was working on February 4, 2024, on the pod where
Youth A, Youth B, and Youth C reside. Staff 1 reported this is a
smaller pod and the ratio at the facility is one staff to eight youth. She
reported on that pod a single staff works solo but can ask for support
and there is also someone watching live camera footage in the
control office. Staff 1 reported within her shift on February 4, 2024,
Youth C had asked her for a grievance form which she provided him.
She asked Youth C if there is something she should be aware of, and
he reported he is sick of Youth B making comments. Staff 1 reported
at that time Youth A jumped into the conversation and stated Youth B
says “gay stuff” to him such as the sexual comments. Staff 1 reported
she provided both Youth A and Youth C with a grievance form and
told them both to sit next to her. She reported Youth B made a
comment about “snitches” on the unit which earned him the
consequence of thirty minutes in his room. Staff 1 reported she was
aware that Youth B was a “three-star” youth in their system which
means they have a risk factor such as suicidal ideation, sexual
conduct charges, or unsafe behavior. She reported this just means
staff is more aware of his potential behaviors and he is to do things
such as shower alone. Staff 1 reported there was never any
disclosure of Youth B touching any of the youth inappropriately on
the unit and never seen any of those acts occur. She reported when
she found out about the comments, she reported it to her upline and
made sure the youth had grievance forms to fill out to get this
situation looked into further. She reported within the unit if youth are
out staff are to keep constant supervision and there should be
appropriate spacing between the youth. Staff 1 reported she always
has her eyes and ears open within the unit and makes sure she
positions herself at the tables to watch over everything that is going
on within the unit. She reported that she has received training in
PREA (Prison Rape Elimination Act) when she was hired.
Supervisor was interviewed face to face at the facility on
February 8, 2024, in collaboration with MDHHS Worker 1.
Supervisor reported one of his roles at the facility is to review and
respond to the grievance forms completed by the youth. He reported
on February 5, 2024, he received grievances from Youth A and
4

Youth C. He stated he spoke with the youth about the allegations,
and asked for specific dates and times so he could have the cameras
reviewed. None of the youth could recall a specific date and time of
the comments being made. Supervisor reported he told Youth A and
Youth C to stay away from Youth B while they investigate the
situation further. He reported he also told Chief Administrator about
the comments. Supervisor reported there was never a disclosure
about Youth B touching anyone on the unit. He was asked about any
prior grievance about Youth B’s sexual behaviors, and he denied
being aware of any. Supervisor reported the facility has zero
tolerance for any type of sexualized behaviors and he encourages
the youth to always report concerns, even if they are minor.
Supervisor reported Youth B is a “three-star” youth in their system,
which means staff should be more aware of potential risky behavior.
He stated being a “three-star” means the youth should not shower
any other youth and should have limited physical contact with other
youth. Supervisor reported on the unit, staff should always have eyes
and ears open to watch what is going on.
Chief Administrator and Administrator were both interviewed
face to face at the facility on February 6, 2024. Chief
Administrator and Administrator reported they were made aware of
Youth B making sexual remarks to Youth A on the unit on February
5, 2024. They reported they talked with both Youth A and Youth B
about these concerns. Youth A was consistent with stating Youth B
sexually harassing him verbally and Youth B denied this occurring.
Chief Administrator and Administrator reported there was never any
disclosure made about Youth B touching Youth A inappropriately.
They reported this did not come up within the interview with the
youth, Staff 1, or Supervisor. Administrator reported when a youth
makes a disclosure about the way another youth is acting towards
them, staff first response is to have that youth stay close to staff
while the situation is getting sorted out.
Tour Observation:
A tour of the facility occurred on February 8, 2024, in
collaboration with MDHHS Worker 1. When walking into the pod
there is a common area and youth’s cells surrounding the area. Off to
one side is the shower area where there is only one stall shower for
one youth to shower at a time. There are about four small square
tables for the youth to sit at. It is possible to reach under the table to
touch someone’s thigh without being seen due to the height of the
tables.
Documents Reviewed:
- Facility incident report dated 02/04/2024 completed by Staff
1- This incident report is consistent with Staff 1’s interview.
- Youth A’s Grievance Form dated 02/04/2024- Youth A
reported in his grievance form, “Youth B asked if he wanted to
5

shower together, asked if he wanted to suck his balls, and asked
if he wanted to spit on his ass.” Supervisor reported on
02/05/2024 stating the concerns were brought to administration,
staff were informed to watch conversations, and told Youth A to
stay away from Youth B.
- Youth C’s Grievance Form dated 02/04/2024- Youth B
reported in his grievance form, “Youth B talks to me sexually and
asks if I want to go into the shower with him; he says he will have
sex with me and violates my boundaries.” Supervisor reported on
02/05/2024 stating the concerns were brought to administration,
staff were informed to watch conversations, and told Youth C to
stay away from Youth B.
- Facility’s Staffing policies and procedures- The staffing ratio
for the facility during awake hours is 1:8 and the staffing ratio
during sleeping hours is 1:20. Staff should position them in a
spot to have eyes on the unit at all times when youth are out
of their rooms.
- Staff 1’s Human Resource File- Staff 1 has no disciplinary
actions within her file. She has completed all required training.
Staff 1 completed Prison Rape Elimination Act (PREA) trainings
in June of 2023.
Analysis Facility is found in compliance with the alleged rule. Staff 1
provided adequate supervision and when she was informed of
concerns from Youth A and Youth C, she made sure the proper
protocol was followed. The facility was never aware of concerns of
touching happening just that Youth B was making inappropriate
comments to youth.
Conclusion Violation Not Established
6

IV. RECOMMENDATION
Based on investigative findings the facility is in compliance with all applicable
licensing statutes and rules. It is recommended that the current license status be
continued.
